intro: Corydalis pseudolongipes, commonly known as the longstem corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Corydalis pseudolongipes is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
